content.title: Heating Effect of electric Current
content.description: Phenomenon where electrical energy is converted into heat energy when an electric current passes through a conductor.

content.title: James Prescott Joule and Joule's Law
content.description: Joule's Law of Heating states that the heat produced in a conductor is directly proportional to the square of the current passing through it, the resistance of the conductor, and the time for which the current flows.

content.title: Arrangement of Resistors in Circuits

content.title: Series Connection
content.description: When resistors are connected in series, they're lined up like a chain. The total resistance is simply the sum of each individual resistor's resistance.

content.title: Parallel Connection
content.description: The total current in the circuit is the sum of current throgh all the branch circuits. In this setup, the voltage across each resistor is the same, but the total current flowing through the group is the sum of the currents through each resistor

content.title: Colour Code of Resistors
content.description: Resistors often have bands of different colors, and each color represents a specific digit or value. The first two rings indicate the two digits, the third one indicated the number of zeroes and the fourth ring indicates tolerance.

content.description: The lighting effect of electric current is what makes bulbs and LEDs shine. When electricity flows through a filament or semiconductor in a light bulb, it gets so excited that it produces light.

content.title: Incandescent lamps
content.description: Incandescent lamps are old-fashioned light bulbs that work by passing electricity through a wire filament, which gets so hot that it produces light. They are not very energy-efficient.

content.title: Why Inert gases/Nitrogen is used in Incandescent Lamps
content.description: Nitrogen is used in incandescent lamps to prevent the filament from burning up. When the filament gets hot, it reacts with oxygen, but if we fill the bulb with nitrogen, it helps to slow down this reaction, extending the life of the bulb

content.title: Refraction in different media

content.title: Snells Law
content.description: The ratio of the sine of the angle of incidence to the sine of the angle of refraction is constant for a given pair of media. This is known as Snell's Law

content.title: Total Internal Reflection
content.description: Total internal reflection happens when light inside a denser medium (like water or glass) tries to go into a less dense medium (like air) at an angle bigger than the critical angle. Instead of going out, the light reflects back inside, like when a swimming pool surface acts like a mirror underwater.
